items.name: Remove label from Linear issue
items.description: Removes a specified label from an existing linear issue using their ids; successful even if the label isn't on the issue.

input_parameters.description: Defines the request structure for removing a label from a Linear issue.

issue_id.description: Identifier of the Linear issue from which to remove the label.
issue_id.title: Issue Id

label_id.description: Identifier of the label to remove. The operation is successful without change if this label isn't on the issue.
label_id.title: Label Id

input_parameters.title: RemoveIssueLabelRequest

issue.description: A dictionary representing the updated Linear issue, including its current list of labels after the operation.
issue.title: Issue

success.description: True if the API call completed without errors; does not imply the label was present and removed.
success.title: Success

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Update issue
items.description: Updates an existing linear issue using its `issue id`; requires at least one other attribute for modification, and all provided entity ids (for state, assignee, labels, etc.) must be valid.

assignee_id.description: Identifier of the user to assign to the issue.
assignee_id.title: Assignee Id

description.description: New Markdown description for the issue.
examples: The payment module fails when users attempt to use a new discount code 'SAVE20'.
description.title: Description

issue_id.description: Identifier of the issue to update.
issue_id.title: Issue Id

label_ids.description: List of label identifiers to set; replaces all existing labels. An empty list removes all labels.
label_ids.title: Label Ids

parent_id.description: Identifier of an existing issue to set as parent.
parent_id.title: Parent Id

project_id.description: Identifier of the project to associate with the issue.
project_id.title: Project Id

state_id.description: Identifier of the new state (e.g., To Do, In Progress, Done).
state_id.title: State Id

team_id.description: Identifier of the team to associate with the issue.
team_id.title: Team Id

examples: Fix critical bug in payment module
title.title: Title

issue.description: Dictionary of the updated issue's attributes.
issue.title: Issue

success.description: Indicates if the update was successful.
success.title: Success

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Create linear attachment
items.description: Creates a new attachment and associates it with a specific, existing linear issue.

issue_id.description: Identifier of the existing Linear issue to which the attachment will be added.
issue_id.title: Issue Id

subtitle.description: Optional subtitle or short description for the attachment.
subtitle.title: Subtitle

url.description: URL of the attachment's content (e.g., file, webpage, online resource).
url.title: Url

id.description: Identifier of the newly created attachment.
id.title: Id

issue_id.description: Identifier of the Linear issue the attachment is associated with.
issue_id.title: Issue Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Create a comment
items.description: Creates a new comment on a specified linear issue.

body.description: Non-empty comment content, in plain text or Markdown.
examples:
## Heading
This is a **bold** comment with markdown.
body.title: Body

issue_id.description: Identifier of the existing Linear issue for the comment.
issue_id.title: Issue Id

body.description: Content of the created comment, possibly Markdown.
body.title: Body

id.description: Unique identifier of the newly created comment.
id.title: Id

user_id.description: Unique identifier of the comment's creator.
user_id.title: User Id

user_name.description: Display name of the comment's creator.
user_name.title: User Name

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Create linear issue
items.description: Creates a new issue in a specified linear project and team, requiring a title and description, and allowing for optional properties like assignee, state, priority, cycle, and due date.

assignee_id.description: Identifier of the user to assign to this issue.
assignee_id.title: Assignee Id

cycle_id.description: Identifier of the cycle (sprint) to assign this issue to. Cycles are time-bound periods used to organize and prioritize work. Only applicable if the team has cycles feature enabled.
cycle_id.title: Cycle Id

description.description: A detailed description of the issue, which can include markdown formatting.
examples:
The login button is unresponsive. This issue started after the v2.3 deployment. Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to the homepage.
2. Click the login button.

Expected: User is redirected to the login page.
Actual: No action occurs.
description.title: Description

due_date.description: The target completion date for the issue, formatted as 'YYYY,MM,DD,hh,mm,ss'. For example: '2024,10,27,12,58,00'.
due_date.title: Due Date

estimate.description: The estimated complexity or effort for the issue, represented as a numerical point value (e.g., 1, 2, 3, 5, 8). The specific scale used (e.g., Fibonacci, Linear, T-shirt sizes mapped to numbers) is defined by the team's settings. This field only applies if the estimates feature is enabled for the team. A value of 0 typically means no estimate has been set.
estimate.title: Estimate

label_ids.description: A list of identifiers for labels to be added to this issue.
label_ids.title: Label Ids

parent_id.description: Identifier of an existing issue to set as the parent of this new issue, creating a sub-issue relationship.
parent_id.title: Parent Id

priority.description: Priority of the issue. 0 indicates no priority, 1 is Urgent, 2 is High, 3 is Normal, and 4 is Low.
priority.title: Priority

project_id.description: Identifier of the project to which this issue will be associated.
project_id.title: Project Id

state_id.description: Identifier of the workflow state to assign to the issue (e.g., backlog, to do, in progress, done).
state_id.title: State Id

team_id.description: Identifier of the team responsible for this issue.
team_id.title: Team Id

title.description: The title of the new issue.
examples: Fix login button bug on homepage
title.title: Title

id.description: The unique identifier of the newly created issue.
id.title: Id

issue_description.description: The description provided for the newly created issue.
issue_description.title: Issue Description

issue_title.description: The title of the newly created issue.
issue_title.title: Issue Title

ticket_url.description: The direct URL to access the newly created issue in the Linear application.
ticket_url.title: Ticket Url

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Get create issue default params
items.description: Fetches a linear team's default issue estimate and state, useful for pre-filling new issue forms.

team.description: Default parameters for new issues in the team, including 'defaultIssueEstimate' (e.g., 0 for complexity/points) and 'defaultIssueState' (object with 'id' and 'name' of the default workflow state, like 'Todo').
team.title: Team

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Create a label
items.description: Creates a new label in linear for a specified team, used to categorize and organize issues.

color.description: Hexadecimal color code (e.g., '#FF0000') for the label's appearance in the UI.
color.title: Color

description.description: Optional detailed description for the label, providing context on its use.
examples: Issues related to critical software bugs.
description.title: Description

name.description: Name of the new label, displayed in the Linear UI.
name.title: Name

team_id.description: Identifier of the team for which this label will be created.
team_id.title: Team Id

color.description: Hexadecimal color code assigned to the label.
color.title: Color

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the label was created.
created_at.title: Created At

description.description: Description provided for the label, if any.
description.title: Description

id.description: Identifier of the newly created label.
id.title: Id

team_id.description: Identifier of the team in which the label was created.
team_id.title: Team Id

updated_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the label was last updated.
updated_at.title: Updated At

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Delete issue
items.description: Archives an existing linear issue by its id, which is linear's standard way of deleting issues; the operation is idempotent.

issue_id.description: Identifier of the Linear issue to be archived. This can be the issue's UUID or its human-readable shorthand ID (e.g., 'TEAM-123').
issue_id.title: Issue Id

success.description: A boolean flag indicating `true` if the issue was successfully archived, or `false` otherwise.
success.title: Success

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Download issue attachments
items.description: Downloads a specific attachment from a linear issue; the `file name` must include the correct file extension.

attachment_id.description: The unique identifier of the specific attachment to download.
attachment_id.title: Attachment Id

file_name.description: The desired name for the downloaded file, including its extension.
file_name.title: File Name

issue_id.description: The unique identifier of the Linear issue from which the attachment will be downloaded.
issue_id.title: Issue Id

file.description: The downloaded attachment file, represented as a FileDownloadable object, which can be used to retrieve the file content.
file.title: File

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Get cycles by team ID
items.description: Retrieves all cycles for a specified linear team id; cycles are time-boxed work periods (like sprints) and the team id must correspond to an existing team.

cycles.description: List of cycles retrieved for the team.

issueCountHistory.description: Historical issue counts in the cycle.
issueCountHistory.title: Issuecounthistory

progress.description: Overall progress of the cycle (decimal value, 0.0 to 1.0).
progress.title: Progress

progressHistory.description: Historical progress values of the cycle.
progressHistory.title: Progresshistory

cycles.title: Cycles

issueCountHistory.description: Historical issue counts in the cycle.
issueCountHistory.title: Issuecounthistory

progress.description: Overall progress of the cycle (decimal value, 0.0 to 1.0).
progress.title: Progress

progressHistory.description: Historical progress values of the cycle.
progressHistory.title: Progresshistory

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Get Linear issue
items.description: Retrieves an existing linear issue's comprehensive details, including title, description, attachments, and comments.

issue_id.description: The unique identifier of the Linear issue.
issue_id.title: Issue Id

issue.description: Comprehensive details of the specified Linear issue, including its title, description, attachments (each with URL, title, ID, source), and comments (each with body, ID, URL, parent ID).
issue.title: Issue

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Get all cycles
items.description: Retrieves all cycles (time-boxed iterations for work) from the linear account; no filters are applied.

cycles.description: List of cycle objects, each with detailed information about a cycle.

createdAt.description: Timestamp (ISO 8601) when the cycle was created.
createdAt.title: Createdat

description.description: Description or notes for the cycle.
description.title: Description

endsAt.description: Scheduled end timestamp (ISO 8601) for the cycle.
endsAt.title: Endsat

number.description: Number of the cycle, often sequential within a team (float value).
number.title: Number

progress.description: Cycle progress (float from 0.0 for 0% to 1.0 for 100%), representing completed work.
progress.title: Progress

id.description: Unique identifier of the team, if the cycle is associated with one.
id.title: Id

name.description: Name of the team; always `None` as this action only retrieves the team ID, not its name.
name.title: Name

team.description: Associated team details. Only the team `id` is provided; the team `name` will be `None`.

cycles.title: Cycles

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: List Linear issues
items.description: Lists non-archived linear issues; if project id is not specified, issues from all accessible projects are returned. can also filter by assignee id to get issues assigned to a specific user.

after.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the `endCursor` from the previous response's `page_info` to fetch the next set of issues.
after.title: After

assignee_id.description: ID of the user to filter issues by assignee. If provided, only issues assigned to this user will be returned.
assignee_id.title: Assignee Id

project_id.description: ID of the project to filter issues by. If provided, only issues belonging to this project will be returned.
project_id.title: Project Id

issues.description: Details for each issue, such as id, title, description, state, priority, assignee, and labels. If `project_id` was not specified in the request, each issue also includes project details.
issues.title: Issues

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Get labels by team
items.description: Retrieves all labels associated with a given team id in linear; the team id must refer to an existing team.

team_id.description: The unique identifier of the team for which to retrieve labels. This ID scopes the search to a specific team within Linear.
team_id.title: Team Id

color.description: The color of the label, represented as a hex color code (e.g., '#RRGGBB').
color.title: Color

description.description: An optional, user-defined description providing more details about the label's purpose or usage.
description.title: Description

id.description: The unique identifier for the label.
id.title: Id

name.description: The display name of the label.
name.title: Name

labels.description: A list of label objects, each containing details such as ID, name, color, and description.

color.description: The color of the label, represented as a hex color code (e.g., '#RRGGBB').
color.title: Color

description.description: An optional, user-defined description providing more details about the label's purpose or usage.
description.title: Description

id.description: The unique identifier for the label.
id.title: Id

name.description: The display name of the label.
name.title: Name

labels.title: Labels

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: List linear projects
items.description: Retrieves all projects from the linear account.

id.description: The unique identifier for the project.
id.title: Id

name.description: The human-readable name of the project.
name.title: Name

projects.description: The retrieved projects; empty if no projects are found.
projects.title: Projects

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: List Linear states
items.description: Retrieves all workflow states for a specified team in linear, representing the stages an issue progresses through in that team's workflow.

id.description: Unique identifier of the workflow state.
id.title: Id

name.description: Name of the workflow state (e.g., 'Todo', 'In Progress', 'Done').
name.title: Name

states.description: Workflow states retrieved for the team.

id.description: Unique identifier of the workflow state.
id.title: Id

name.description: Name of the workflow state (e.g., 'Todo', 'In Progress', 'Done').
name.title: Name

states.title: States

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Get teams by project
items.description: Retrieves all teams, including their members, and filters each team's associated projects by the provided 'project id'.

project_id.description: The unique identifier of a project. This ID is used to filter the list of projects associated with each retrieved team. If a team is not associated with this project ID, its 'projects' list in the response will be empty.
project_id.title: Project Id

id.description: The unique identifier of the team.
id.title: Id

members.description: List of members belonging to this team. Each object in the list typically contains the member's `id`, `name`, and `email`.
members.title: Members

projects.description: Projects associated with this team, filtered by the request's `project_id`; each object contains the project `id`.
projects.title: Projects

teams.description: All teams, each including details, members, and associated projects filtered by the request's `project_id`.
teams.title: Teams

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: List Linear users
items.description: Lists all users in the linear workspace with their ids, names, emails, and active status.

after.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the `endCursor` from the previous response's `page_info` to fetch the next set of users.
after.title: After

users.description: List of users with their details including id, name, email, and active status.
users.title: Users

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

items.name: Run Query or Mutation
items.description: Executes a user-provided graphql query or mutation against the linear api, intended for advanced data operations or those not covered by other specific actions.

query_or_mutation.description: A valid GraphQL query or mutation string.
examples: mutation CreateIssue($title: String!, $teamId: String!) { issueCreate(input: { title: $title, teamId: $teamId }) { success issue { id title } } }
query_or_mutation.title: Query Or Mutation

variables.description: Variables for the GraphQL operation, where keys match variable names in the query/mutation (without '$'). Use {} if no variables are needed.
variables.title: Variables

data.description: The 'data' field from the GraphQL JSON response, containing the results of the executed query or mutation. If the operation fails at the GraphQL level (e.g., validation error), this field might be absent or accompanied by an 'errors' field in the raw response, which would be handled by an exception.
data.title: Data

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful
